Detailed Description

The table of known options.

The main (and the only) class to be used by the end user. It stores the information about the program including the general description, all known options and arguments, parses the command line phrase basing on the elements, and may output the usage and/or help messages as well as prepare the manual page for the program.

Within this class the variables ending with "*_long_desc" would be shown in the verbose help message and will go to the manual pages. The variables ending with "*_desc" would be shown in both verbose and non-verbose help messages.

OptionTable & poptmx::OptionTable::add ( const OptionTable &  _val)

Incorporates preexisting option table into the table.

First puts the general_desc and general_long_desc into the note-entry of the table. Then adds all entries of the _val to the table one-by-one.

Parameters:
_valThe table to be incorporated.

OptionTable & poptmx::OptionTable::add ( Kind  _kind,
const std::string &  _short_desc,
const std::string &  _long_desc = "" 
)

Adds note or man.

Adds new note or manual page string to the entry table. If adding the note just copies the *_desc into the appropriate elements of the entry. If adding man-page then behaviour is more complex: If the long description is empty then adds the short description would appear in the man file as is, without any changes. Otherwise will add the short description as the section header and long description as the section's text.

Parameters:
_kindKind of entry to add. In this context can be ::NOTE or ::MAN
_short_descNote which would appear in the help messages and manual page
_long_descNote which would appear in the verbose help message and manual page

int poptmx::OptionTable::count ( const void *  _val = 0) const

Returns number of times the entry was processed in parse().

Parameters:
_valThe value to check.
Returns:
If _val is non-zero - number of the times the entry was triggered from the CLI phrase. If _val is zero - number of times all entries were triggered.

string poptmx::OptionTable::desc ( const void *  _val) const

Returns the description of the entry with the value.

If the entry does not exist in the table and the pointer is non-zero, the returned string is the pointer mark which later, after the entry was added to the table, can be replaced using the ::replacePointers(string &).

Parameters:
_valThe value to check
Returns:
Description.

OptionTable::ListO poptmx::OptionTable::find ( ) const [private]

Finds first parse-able argument.

Finds the first of the argument entries in the table which can take one more value: i.e. either an argument which was not met before, or the argument which accept multiple entries.

Returns:
The pointer to the table entry or 0-pointer if no entry is found.

void poptmx::OptionTable::replacePointers ( std::string &  str) [private]

Replaces all pointer marks.

Scans the string for the pointer marks, reads the pointer and replaces the mark with the description given by ::desc(const void*).

Parameters:
strstring to be changed.

std::string poptmx::OptionTable::general_desc [private]

Short description of the program. If the table is included into another option table, this description becomes the short_desc of the note preceeding the included elements.

std::string poptmx::OptionTable::general_synopsis [private]

The string with the synopsis of the program: to be found in the manual page and help messages. If not set then it is automatically generated from the table of options.
